headline: 3 reasons US stocks are lagging behind global markets
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) are off to their weakest start to a year compared to the global markets since 1995, according to new data from Goldman Sachs (GS). Meanwhile, Japan has announced a plan to invest $36 billion in US oil, gas, and critical mining projects. Yahoo Finance Breaking Business News Reporter Jake Conley joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to discuss how higher valuations, heavy tech concentration, and geopolitical risks are pushing investors to look overseas. He also offers some insight into Japan's investment plans. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: 3 reasons US stocks are lagging behind global markets
content.description:
US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) are off to their weakest start to a year compared to the global markets since 1995, according to new data from Goldman Sachs (GS).

Meanwhile, Japan has announced a plan to invest $36 billion in US oil, gas, and critical mining projects.

Yahoo Finance Breaking Business News Reporter Jake Conley joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to discuss how higher valuations, heavy tech concentration, and geopolitical risks are pushing investors to look overseas. He also offers some insight into Japan's investment plans.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

Yahoo Finance Breaking Business News Reporter Jake Conley joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to discuss how higher valuations, heavy tech concentration, and geopolitical risks are pushing investors to look overseas. He also offers some insight into Japan's investment plans. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.
